threads.com:
/vmg/ is a place to discuss all types of mobile games, including both Android and iOS, phones and tablets. Please note that Nintendo and Sony handhelds are considered consoles, and that threads pertaining to those platforms and their gaming titles should be posted elsewhere.

Does this mean discussion of mobile games is banned on other video game boards? No! /vmg/ is just a separate board specifically focused on mobile games where discussions about your favorite games can thrive.

Please familiarize yourself with the rules and remember to use the spoiler function where appropriate!

Please note that, like /v/, "Generals"—long-term, one-after-the-other, recurring threads about a specific game are not permitted on /vmg/. Such threads belong on >>>/vg/

last_replies.com: Is arcane grima better than base Idunn's prf?

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>1057636
Depends on build but since most people use tanks for tanking I'd say no, her Prf is probably the best breath she can use. Her Prf gives armor effectiveness ( which is rather negligible for a tank but allows her to tank bust other tanks so not bad), +4 all stats (which is ok), neutralizes own penalties (really good skill for a tank), spendthrift effect (great effect which effectively gives +5 atk/def/res), and 70% DR if foe doubles on the first hit.

I'll say Arcane Grima is a great alternative over her Prf still since slaying, auto doubles, and healing is amazing too. I believe prf is better only marginally but both are viable.

It’s good that you’ve gotten that far in the story, don’t forget hard mode as it also gives extra Shallot Zpower. At this point it may be better to prioritize the events currently up that give free characters. such as the GT SS Goku / Super 17. The world domination event is a free pickup if you pulled the SuperHero characters. If you hit a bottleneck of resources, check the exchange shops and you’ll find easy sources of energy and tickets.

Also, equipments become more important the further you progress. It’s hard to roll A equipment starting out so in general keep anything B or higher. The equipment collection battles in the upgrade tab has a set for almost every tag; you’ll get the most mileage out of the saiyan, GT, or movies battles. Once you start playing PvP you can trade equipment medals for a broader selection. Equipments typically buff your base stats same as z-abilities but the more valuable ones have slots like “strike/blast damage” which takes all your stat bonuses into account. One of the best equipments is the youth Goku “it’s all up to my fists!” which is one of the few that increases vanish restore and can be used on any Goku character.

Basically for Pikmin 3 you have a in game "day" to complete your activities and explore. At the end of the day you have to be back by the ship (it may warp you over there or something but i don't remember) and any pikmin outside of your party are killed at the end of the day by the bulborbs.

Pikmin 3 is a little different from 1/2 which had a strict 30 day "time limit" before you got a Game Over. In 3, you can extend your time by finding the fruit to make the juice. One is consumed at the end of the day and i believe if you find every single fruit in the game you can have a max of 99 days on the planet, but i think you'd probably wouldn't need more than 30 if you're just doing normal stuff and working on the story.

don't forget to grab astronomer, marbles, mirror, circular saw, amplifier, ANYTHING that powers up your satellites, they are your main damage dealers
you can power up the lava zones later in late game when you switch to a more defensive stance
shit like armageddon, arcane ray and energy bullets can be 100% ignored, hell i would personally avoid magic bullets and spirits too and focus on stuff that has good synergy with the cauldron, like the fireballs or incinerate flamestrike
